parameter.FrequencyPenalty: Penalizes frequent tokens to reduce repetition
parameter.MaxTokens: Limits the number of tokens in the output
parameter.PresencePenalty: Penalizes tokens that have already appeared to encourage new topics
parameter.Temperature: Controls randomness; lower is more focused, higher is more creative
parameter.Title: Parameters
parameter.TopK: Samples from the top K most likely tokens
parameter.TopP: Samples from tokens whose cumulative probability is within P

session.AnotherUserSession: This session was created by another user.
session.CheckAgainDialog: This action cannot be undone. Do you want to proceed?
session.CreationFailed: Session creation failed. Please try again in few minutes.
session.DescCommitSession: You are about to commit container corresponding to the session below:
session.ExportSessionListToCSVFile: Export Session list to CSV File
session.ForceTerminateWarningMsg: This action will terminate or cancel the session regardless of its current status. Are you sure?
session.ForceTerminateWarningMsg2: Execute only when the state does not change for an unreasonably long period of time.
session.ForceTerminateWarningMsg3: This action does not delete the actual containers on the agent(s). Manual cleanup may be required.
session.GracePeriodDesc: Utilization idle checker will be activated after this initial grace time. During this time, sessions are not terminated even if utilization is low.
session.IdleCheckExpirationWarning: Sessions may be terminated if an Idleness Check determines inactivity.
session.IdleChecksDesc: Backend.AI supports inactivity (idleness) criteria for automatic garbage collection of compute sessions.
session.InputTensorboardPath: Please input log directory that TensorBoard will refer to. Note that the log directory will not be automatically created..
session.MaxSessionLifetimeDesc: Force-terminate sessions after this time from creation. It prevents the session from running infinitely.
session.NetworkIdleTimeoutDesc: Force-terminate sessions that do not exchange data with the user (browser or web app) after this time. Traffic between the user and the compute session continuously occurs when the user interacts with an app, like terminal or Jupyter, by keyboard input, Jupyter cell creation, etc. Jupyter cell creation, etc. If there is no interaction for a certain period, the condition of garbage collection will be met. Even if there is a process executing a job in the compute session, it is subject to termination if there is no user interaction.
session.NoLogMsgAvailable: No log message available on current state
session.NotInProject: This session belongs to a different project
session.OpenToPublicDesc:
Enabling this option allows application access for all users within the network.

For access management, enter specific IP addresses in the 'Allowed IP' field.

Leaving this field empty will permit access from all IP addresses.

Consider setting IP restrictions when necessary for security management.
session.RecentlyCreatedSessionsTooltip: Shows the {{count}} most recently created running sessions in the current project
session.SFTPDescription: You can upload files quickly and securely through an SSH/SFTP client. If you haven't uploaded your SSH key pair beforehand, please click the "DOWNLOAD SSH KEY" button to save your SSH key first. You can then use that key to execute commands such as SFTP, SCP, and Rsync.
session.SFTPExtraNotification: It is recommended to delete sessions after they have been used, as there is a limit on the number of sessions. Sessions that are not used for uploading files within a certain period of time may be automatically deleted.
session.SFTPSessionManagementDesc: On the "Session - Upload Session" page, you can manage the list of sessions for file uploads.
session.SessionNotFound: You do not have permission to access this session or the session does not exist.
session.UseYourFavoriteMSTSCApp: Use your favorite MS Remote Desktop app
session.UtilizationIdleTimeoutDesc: Force-terminate sessions based only on the utilization of resources allocated to them.
session.UtilizationThresholdDesc: Threshold criteria of each compute resource. When one or more resource of a compute session does not exceed the configured threshold criteria for a certain time, the session will be garbage collected (terminated). For example, if you set 1% of CUDA utilization threshold, compute sessions that show less than 1% CUDA GPU utilization, for a certain duration of time, will be destroyed. Resources with empty values are excluded from the garbage collection criteria.
session.VSCodeRemoteDescription: You can launch your local Visual Studio Code application and connect to the remote compute session (via SSH) using the password below. Please copy the password before clicking the button. (NOTE: You have to install Visual Studio Code in your local machine.)
session.VSCodeRemoteNoticeSSHConfig: To set up a seamless connection for Visual Studio Code to the remote compute session, create or edit the $HOME/.ssh/config file and add the following block.
session.VSCodeRemotePasswordTitle: Visual Studio Code remote SSH password

appLauncher.AppMustBeRun: Start only when the app is already running
appLauncher.AppMustBeRunDialog: This app can only be accessed and used if it is already running through the terminal. If not, you will be directed to an error page that occurs when the app is not running.
appLauncher.NoExistingConnectionExample: No Connection Example to be copied.
appLauncher.SSHConnectionExampleClipboardCopy: SSH Connection Example has been copied to the clipboard.

launcher.AutoSharedMemoryTooltip: You can automatically select or manually enter the shared memory size within the allocated memory.
launcher.BatchJobTimeoutDurationDesc: Set the maximum execution time for batch jobs. The session will automatically terminate if the specified time is exceeded.
launcher.BatchModeDesc: runs your code with multiple node & clusters to scale your idea
launcher.DescAIAccelerator: AI accelerators (GPUs or NPUs) are well-suited for the matrix/vector computations involved in machine learning. AI accelerators speed up training / inference algorithms by orders of magnitude, reducing running times from weeks to days.
launcher.DescCPU:
The CPU performs basic arithmetic, logic, controlling, and input/output (I/O) operations specified by the instructions.

For high performance computing workloads, many CPUs are helpful, but the program code must be written to use multiple CPUs.
launcher.DescFolderAlias:
If you fill out this input, folder name will change to alias when it mount.

Absolute paths will be mount in '/', the others are sub path of /home/work

Don't use alias same as system folders.

Please check final path which is printed in 'Mounted folders' below.

If you want to see this window again, click icon next to the 'Path & Alias'
launcher.DescMemory:
Computer memory is a temporary storage area.

It holds the data and instructions that the Central Processing Unit (CPU) needs.

When using a GPU in a machine learning workload, you must allocate at least twice the memory of the GPU to memory. Otherwise, the GPU's idle time will increase, resulting in a performance penalty.
launcher.DescMultiNode: When running a session, one managed node and one or more worker nodes are split across multiple physical nodes or virtual machines.
launcher.DescOpenMPOptimization:
This value sets the number of threads to use for parallel regions by setting the initial value of the nthreads-var internal control variable.

Backend.AI sets this value equal to the number of CPU cores, which has the effect of accelerating typical high-performance computing workloads. However, for some multi-threaded workloads, multiple processes using OpenMP are used at the same time, resulting in an abnormally large number of threads and significant performance degradation. In this case, please adjust this value to 1 or 2.
launcher.DescSelectAgent: The resources shown on the right side of each agent represent the actual available capacity. The selected agents indicate the candidates that can be allocated, and even if multiple agents are selected, the allocation may be made to only one agent. By default, the scheduler automatically handles the allocation.
launcher.DescSelectAgentBefore2516: The resources displayed on the right side of the agent represent the actual amount of available resources. Currently, agent selection is only available in a single-node single-container environment. The default setting is agent allocation by the scheduler.
launcher.DescSession:
A session is a unit of computational environment that is created according to a specified environment and resources.

If this value is set to a value greater than 1, multiple sessions corresponding to the resource set above are created.

If there are not enough resources available, requests to create sessions that cannot be created are put on the waiting queue.
launcher.DescSetEnv:
If you set a default environment variable in the container and also set an environment variable with the same name on the Backend.AI, the value set on the Backend.AI takes precedence.

Every input value will be initialized after starting session launcher.
Also, those environment will be passed only if both variable and value are not empty.
launcher.DescSetPreOpenPort: 'Preopen Ports' refers to a specific internal container port that allows incoming connections from external devices or computers on a network device or computer.
launcher.DescSharedMemory: Shared memory is memory that may be simultaneously accessed by multiple programs with an intent to provide communication among them or avoid redundant copies.
launcher.DescSharedMemoryContext: For multi-GPU or multi-process workloads, shared memory is important because it is used for inter-process communication. For deep learning workloads and high performance computing workloads using multi-process, we recommend setting this value to 1 GB or higher.
launcher.DescSingleNode: When running a session, the managed node and worker nodes are placed on a single physical node or virtual machine.
launcher.EnqueueComputeSessionWarning: Insufficient resources. Session may be pending.
launcher.EnvConfigWillDisappear: Any unsaved environment variable and value will disappear.
launcher.EnvironmentVariableDuplicateName: A variable name that already exists.
launcher.EnvironmentVariableNamePatternError: Variable name must start with a letter or underscore, and can only contain letters, numbers, and underscores.
launcher.EnvironmentVariableTitle: Order of precedence: container vs Backend.AI internal variables
launcher.ErrorCanNotExceedRemaining: Cannot be set to greater than the remaining resources ({{amount}}).
launcher.FailedToConnectCoordinator: Failed to connect to the app administration. Please check your network connection and firewall settings.
launcher.FailedToStartNewSession: Session creation failed. Please check the 'FINISHED' tab on the session page.
launcher.FolderAliasInvalid: Only alphanumeric characters, underscore (_), slash (/), dot (.), and dash (-) are allowed.
launcher.FolderAliasOverlapping: Aliases overlap with other names that already exist
launcher.FolderAliasOverlappingToAutoMount: An auto-mount folder with the same name exists.
launcher.HomeDirectoryDeletionDialog: The home directory in the session is automatically deleted when the session ends.
launcher.ImageDoesNotProvideModelPath: Container image does not provide model path. It should be modified.
launcher.InsufficientAllocationOfResourcesWarning: Allocatable resources falls below the minimum resource required in the selected image.
launcher.InteractiveModeDesc: allows you to create, test and run code interactively via jupyter notebook, visual studio code, etc.
launcher.InvalidMountsSelectionWarning:
Folder selection information is not valid. 
Check out the selected folder.
launcher.InvalidPortFormat: The port number format is incorrect.
launcher.LaunchConfirmationDialog: To keep your code and data, or share it with other collaborators, simply create a storage folder in the data & storage sidebar, then mount that folder when you start the resource and keep it there.
launcher.LaunchSessionWithAccessKey: Launch session on behalf of the access key
launcher.MinMemory: The minimum memory capacity for the currently selected runtime environment is {{size}}iB.
launcher.MiniumAllocationTooltip: Select as the minimum requirement for the selected running environment
launcher.MustSpecifyVersion: You must specify Environment and Version.
launcher.NeoSwitchDescription: You are using the "{{launcher}}" session launcher.
launcher.NoAvailableFolderToMount: There's no available folder to mount.
launcher.NoEnvConfigured: No additional environment variable is configured
launcher.OnlyAllowsDiscreteNumberByClusterSize: Only integer is allowed when cluster size is not less than 2.
launcher.OnlyAllowsDiscreteNumberByQuantumSize: The value must be a multiple of {{stepSize}}.
launcher.PinnedHistoryTooltip: Click the pin icon to pin the history. Pinned item will be retained.
launcher.PleaseCompleteForm: Form is incomplete or contains errors. Please check your inputs.
launcher.PreOpenPortMaxCountLimit: You can set up to {{count}} preopen port.
launcher.PreOpenPortMaxCountLimit_plural: You can set up to {{count}} preopen ports.
launcher.PreOpenPortRange: Preopen ports are available from 1024 to 65535.
launcher.PreOpenPortRangeGuide: Enter multiple values separated by either a comma (,) or a space.
launcher.PrePortConfigWillDisappear: Any unsaved preopen ports will disappear.
launcher.ProxyDirectTCPNotSupported: Proxy direct TCP connection is not supported yet
launcher.ProxyNotReady: Proxy is not ready yet. Check proxy settings for detail.
launcher.ResetFormConfirm: Do you want to reset all your entries?
launcher.SHMEMShouldBeLessThanHalfOfAppMemory: Shared memory is recommended to be less than half of the application memory.
launcher.SessionNameAllowCondition: Session name should have 4-64 alphabets/numbers without any whitespaces.
launcher.SessionStillPreparing: The session is still in preparation. After the session starts, tap the app icon to start the app.
launcher.SettingUpProxyForApp: Setting up proxy for the app...
launcher.SharedMemorySettingIsReduced: Shared memory setting is reduced to below the allocated memory.
launcher.StartTimeDoesNotApply: If the start time is not set, it doesn't apply.
launcher.StartTimeMustBeInTheFuture: The start time must be after the current time.
launcher.YouCanStartWithHistory: These are your recently created session records. Click a session name to start a new session.

validation.EnterValidSessionName: Please enter a combination of at least 4 alphabet letters, or numbers, or hyphen, or underscore.
validation.PleaseFollowSessionNameRule: Please enter a combination of at least 4 letters, numbers, '.', '_', and '-'.
validation.SessionNameInvalidCharacter: The middle of a name can only contain alphabet letters, numbers, and '_'.
validation.SessionNameShouldEndWith: It must end with an alphabet letter, a number, or '_'.
validation.SessionNameShouldStartWith: It must start with an alphabet letter, a number, or '_'.

settings.CUDAGPUdisabledByFGPUsupport: Disabled because system uses Fractional GPU plugin
settings.ConfigPerJobSchdulerDescription: The values in the scheduler setting is the defaults to use when there is no scheduler setting in each resource group. If there is a resource group-specific setting, this value will be ignored.
settings.DescAllowAgentSideRegistration: Allow agent to register itself to manager. Use only if Backend.AI cluster is managed on secure location.
settings.DescCudaGPUSupport: NVIDIA CUDA GPU support. Requires Backend.AI CUDA Plugin.
settings.DescFractionalGPU: Use Fractional GPU feature with GPU virtualization.
settings.DescImagePullBehavior: Determines the conditions for automatically downloading new images when a new version is registered in the registry. For none, new images will not be automatically downloaded.
settings.DescRocmGPUSupport: AMD ROCm GPU support. Requires Backend.AI ROCm Plugin.
settings.DescUseCLIonGUI: Provide Backend.AI CLI on GUI app/web. Requires Backend.AI CLI image.
settings.DescUseGUIonWeb: Provide Backend.AI GUI as a web service. Requires Backend.AI Web UI image.
settings.EnvConfigWillDisappear: Any unsaved environment variable and value will disappear.
settings.FifoOnly: Currently, changes are only possible when the scheduler is FIFO.
settings.InvalidValue: Please put the correct input value.
settings.MTUDescription: Maximum transmission unit, the size of the largest packet that a network protocol can transmit.
settings.NoChangesToDisplay: There are no changes to display
settings.NoteAboutFixedSetup: The settings below are automatically applied depending on the installation environment and status.
settings.OverlayNetworkConfiguration: Configuration to use when creating overlay networks.
settings.OverlayNetworkSettingsDescription: An overlay network is a computer network that is layered on top of another network. The overlay network creates a distributed network among multiple Docker daemon hosts of the Backend.AI manager.
settings.RequireFGPUPlugin: Requires Backend.AI Virtual CUDA API Layer Plugin.
settings.RequireTPUPlugin: Requires resource nodes on Google Cloud with Cloud TPU enabled / binded.
settings.SchedulerSelectComment: Select the scheduler to change the options.
settings.SessionCreationRetriesDescription: If the session creation fails, the session creation is retried for the value specified in here. If the session cannot be created within the trials, the request will be ignored and Backend.AI will process the next request.

signUp.EmailVerificationFailedMessage: We're unable to verify your email. Your token may be invalid or expired. Write your email address and click send button to get new verification code.
signUp.EmailVerifiedMessage: Your email is verified! Now you can login with your account.
signUp.PasswordInvalid: Use 8 or more characters with a mix of letters, numbers & symbols.
signUp.PasswordNotMatched: Password didn't match. Try it again.
signUp.PolicyAgreement_1: I have read and agree to the
signUp.RequestAgreementTermsOfService: Please read and agree with the terms of service to proceed.
signUp.VerificationMessage: Verification email is sent to your email address. Please read and follow the steps specified in the email before login with your account.

start.CreateFolderDesc: Create folders and upload files. To train models or provide external services, it is essential to create folders and upload files.
start.ModelServiceDesc: Select to share your trained model with others. This action will create a model service.
start.StartBatchSessionDesc: Create a batch session for predefined files or scheduled tasks. Enter the command, set the date and time, and run the session on demand.
start.StartFromExampleDesc: Explore various example codes and get started.
start.StartFromURLDesc: Import your project and code from various environments such as GitHub, GitLab, Notebook, etc.
start.StartSessionDesc: Create a session to train a model. Choose your preferred environment and resources to run a code.

statistics.CPUDesc: The number of CPU cores allocated to the compute sessions.
statistics.GPUDesc: The number of GPU units allocated to the compute sessions. If the Fractional GPU feature is enabled, it may not match the physics GPU.
statistics.IOReadDesc: This amount of the data read from the compute session. (The amount of data read from externally mounted devices such as data folders is not included.)
statistics.IOWriteDesc: The amount of the data write from the compute session. (The amount of data write from externally mounted devices such as data folders is not included.)
statistics.MemoryDesc: The amount of memory allocated to the compute sessions.
statistics.SessionsDesc: The number of compute sessions created.
statistics.UsageHistoryNote: The usage history shown here are based on terminated compute sessions.

description.CPUUtilization:
Represents the amount of CPU time used by the session during the selected period. 

A single CPU core corresponds to a maximum of 100%.
If multiple cores are allocated, the total usage can exceed 100%, as it is calculated by summing up the maximum usage (100%) of each core.
description.NetworkRx:
Indicates the network transfer rate.  

Represents the rate at which the container is receiving network data.
description.NetworkTx:
Indicates the network transfer rate. 

 Represents the rate at which the container is sending network data.

prometheus.DataMissingInLowUsageDesc: If usage is low, data for some dates may not be available. Please try again with a shorter date range.

storageHost.BeCarefulToSetProjectResourcePolicy: Changing a resource policy can affect all projects that use that project resource policy, so use it with care.
storageHost.BeCarefulToSetUserResourcePolicy: Changing a resource policy can impact all users who rely on it. Please proceed with caution.
storageHost.DoYouWantToUseDefaultValue: Do you want to use default value?
storageHost.QuotaDoesNotSupported: This storage backend does not support quota.

quotaSettings.ClickSettingButton: No quota settings. If you want to set quota configs, click the button below.
quotaSettings.ConfirmUnsetCustomQuota:
Are you sure you want to unset? 
If you unset, the quota of this user or project will use default value.
quotaSettings.SelectFirst: Please select a user or project from the selector above.

summary.NoAnnouncement: There is no announcement to display.
summary.NoInvitations: There is no invitations to display.

theme.PreviewModeAlert: You are currently using the theme preview mode. Please proceed with your actual work in the original window.

totp.ConfirmTotpRemovalBody: Are you sure to opt out from using two-factor authentication?
totp.EnterConfirmationCode: Now enter OTP generated by the authenticator to verify.
totp.ScanQRToEnable: Scan QR code with your authenticator to start setting up two-factor authentication.
totp.TotpSetupNotAvailable: Two-factor authentication cannot be set up.
totp.TypeInAuthKey: Alternatively, you can type in authentication code below manually.

neoSessionLauncher.FixErrorAndTryAgainText: If there is an error field, the Launch session button is disabled. Please correct the error and try again.
neoSessionLauncher.FixErrorFieldByModifyButton: For that error field, you can go directly to the Edit button in the top right corner to edit it.
neoSessionLauncher.ValidationErrorText: If you don't enter a value in a required field or enter an invalid value, an error message displays in that field.

userSettings.BackToClassicFeatures: Switch back to the Classic UI
userSettings.BackToClassicFeaturesDesc: You can choose the Classic UI instead of the latest NEO UI. Please note that some of the latest features may not be supported in the Classic UI.
userSettings.BootstrapScriptDescription: Bootstrap script will be executed only once after session creation
userSettings.BootstrapScriptEmpty:
The script is empty. 
Please enter the script.
userSettings.ClassicFeaturesDesc: Rolling back to a classic version can help you regain stability and functionality while you wait for updates or fixes to be released.
userSettings.ClearSSHKeypairInput: Written SSH Keypair will be removed. Are you sure you want to continue?
userSettings.DescAutoLogout: Log out automatically if all logined pages are closed except session originated pages for apps(e.g. jupyter notebook, web terminal, etc.)
userSettings.DescAutomaticUpdateCheck:
Notify when a new webui version is released.
If the feature is automatically disabled, clicking the toggle again will resume update checks.
userSettings.DescBetaFeatures:
Use beta features for Web UI.
Beta features may be unstable. Some beta features may not be adopted as official feature.
userSettings.DescDesktopNotification:
Enables desktop notifications.
When turned on, Backend.AI also uses the operating system’s notification system. Turning this off does not affect notifications within the web UI. Depending on the operating system, notification permissions may need to be enabled in system settings.
userSettings.DescExperimentalDashboard: Use Dashboard page instead of Summary page.
userSettings.DescKeepLoginSessionInformation:
Let webui app keep current login session information next time.
If the option is turned off, login information will be cleared each logout.
userSettings.DescLanguage: Set interface language. Languages other than English and Korean will be provided via machine translation.
userSettings.DescLetUserUpdateScriptWithNonEmptyValue: Please update script with non empty value.
userSettings.DescMaxConcurrentUploads: Limits the number of files that can be uploaded simultaneously through the File Explorer.
userSettings.DescNewUserConfigFileCreated: New User config file can be created with non-empty data.
userSettings.DescPreferredSSHPort:
Use this value as an SSH/SFTP port if possible.
If the port is already in use, assign another random port to SSH/SFTP. Leave blank to auto-assign.
userSettings.DescSSHKeypairManagement: Change the SSH keypair by generating one randomly or by entering it manually.
userSettings.DescScriptAllDeleted: All of created user config script were deleted.
userSettings.DescScriptCreated: User config script created. This will be applied to new sessions only.
userSettings.DescScriptUpdated: User config script updated. This will be applied to new sessions only.
userSettings.DescThemeMode: Customize how Backend.AI WebUI looks on your device.
userSettings.DescUseCompactSidebar:
Compact sidebar provides more workspace.
When enabled, the compact sidebar will be the default UI at startup.
userSettings.DialogDiscardOrSave: Current file and script will be changed without saving, Would you like to proceed?
userSettings.DialogNoSaveNoPreserve: Your changes will be lost if you don't save them.
userSettings.ExperimentalFeaturesDesc: Access new experimental features early—these may change or be removed in future updates.
userSettings.InvalidPortNumber: Port number should be positive number between 1025~65534
userSettings.KeepLoginSessionInformation: Keep Login Session Information while Logout
userSettings.NoExistingSSHKeypair: No SSH Keypair to be copied. To get SSH Keypair, Please press Generate button.
userSettings.SSHKeyClipboardCopy: SSH Key has been copied to the clipboard.
userSettings.SSHKeypairEnterManuallyFinished: SSH Keypair has been successfully registered.
userSettings.SSHKeypairGenerationWarning: You cannot get private key again. Store on your local disk if needed.
userSettings.SessionTerminationDialog: Session termination cannot be undone. Do you want to proceed to terminate the session?

theme.CustomThemeSettingAlert: The updated theme cannot be applied immediately. If you would like to apply the theme, please contact our support team with the exported configuration JSON file.
theme.ErrorColorDesc: The color applied to buttons or alert representing critical actions, such as deletion, to indicate warnings or errors.
theme.HeaderBgDesc: The color applied to the header background, except for the logo section.
theme.InfoColorDesc: The color that applies to information guidance and modification icons, which is used for elements that communicate information to users.
theme.LinkColorDesc: The color used for links that redirect to another page or open additional UI elements such as drawers or modals.
theme.PrimaryColorDesc: The main color applied to buttons or descriptive text that represent key actions. It is also applied as the background color for the logo section in the header.
theme.SuccessColorDesc: The color applied to buttons, alerts, or icons that indicate a user action has been successfully completed.
theme.TextColorDesc: The color used for general text.

webTerminalUsageGuide.CopyGuide: Advanced Web Terminal Usage: Copy terminal contents
webTerminalUsageGuide.CopyGuideFour: To turn on mouse scroll again, Press Ctrl + B and Type :set -g mouse on and Press Enter key.
webTerminalUsageGuide.CopyGuideOne: Press Ctrl + B key to enter tmux control mode.
webTerminalUsageGuide.CopyGuideThree: Now you can copy text from the terminal.
webTerminalUsageGuide.CopyGuideTwo: Type :set -g mouse off and Press Enter Key.

webui.AdminOnlyPage:
You don't have permission to access this page.
Click the button below to redirect to summary page.
webui.DescNotFound: Sorry, the page you are looking for could not be found.
webui.NetworkSoftTimeout: The server is taking longer to respond. Please wait a moment
webui.YouAreOffline: Offline: Not connected to any networks.

menu.FullNameInvalid: Full name should not exceed 64 characters
menu.InvalidPasswordMessage: At least 1 alphabet, 1 number and 1 special character is required with at least 8 chars.
menu.MyResourcesDescription:
This panel displays your total resources currently used and free across all projects and resource groups.

When multiple limits are applied (such as domain, project, or keypair), the calculation uses the most restrictive free resource limit.
menu.MyResourcesInResourceGroupDescription: This panel shows how much resource you have used and how much is free in the selected resource group of your current project.
menu.NewPasswordCannotBeSame: Please enter a password that is different from your current password.
menu.NewPasswordMismatch: Two new passwords do not match.
menu.PasswordChangePlace: Click the person icon on the top bar and go to the "My Account" menu.
menu.TotalResourcesInResourceGroupDescription: This panel shows the total used and free resources in the selected resource group. The values are calculated by summing the used and free amounts of all agents using that group.
menu.YouMushChangeYourPassword: It is recommended to periodically change your password for security reasons. Since a certain amount of time has passed since you last changed your password, you must change it in order to continue using the service.
